newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Zinc treatment fees fall-Western Met.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Zinc treatment fees fall-Western Met.

text.p: The outlook for treatment charges paid by mining companies to zinc smelters has tipped dramatically in favour of miners, Australian zinc and lead miner Western Metals Ltd said on Thursday.

"Contrary to earlier estimates, the supply of zinc concentrates has remnained tight and a number of recent mine closures have made mining companies more aggressive in this year's negotiations," Western Metals general manager commercial, Max Brundson said in a statement.
He said this year non-integrated miners will seek treatment charges in a range of US$155 to $165 a tonne, well below last year's benchmark of US$190.
Supplies of lead concentrates also remained tight and the short-term outlook is for prices to increase, he added.

Western Metals mines zinc and lead at the Cadjebut and Goongewa deposits in the Kimberley region of Western Australia. It also is developing the Kapok and Blendevale zinc/lead deposits in the same region.
